generator.group: Murdoch Children’s Research Institute, Parkville, VIC, Australia

contact.group: Murdoch Children’s Research Institute, Parkville, VIC, Australia

publications.title: Generation and heterozygous repair of human iPSC lines from three individuals with cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy and vestibular areflexia syndrome (CANVAS) carrying biallelic AAGGG expansions in RFC1

donor.disease_name: Cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy, and vestibular areflexia syndrome
donor.disease_description: Progressive neurodegenerative disorder caused by biallelic AAGGG expansions in RFC1

genomic_modifications.description: Heterozygous deletion of AAGGG expansion in RFC1 using CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing

genomic_characterisation.summary: No aneuploidies or large deletions or insertions detected. SNPduo comparison confirmed >99.9% identity between iPSC lines and parental fibroblast line.

induced_derivation.non_int_vector_name: pEP4 E02S ET2K, pEP4 E02S EN2L, pEP4 E02S EM2K, pSimple-miR302/367

ethics.institutional_HREC: Human Research Ethics Committee of the Royal Children’s Hospital (HREC 28097), Victoria, Australia
